decks.notes: The main focus of this Mono Blue Aggro deck is to quickly and efficiently control the board while pressuring the opponent with aggressive creatures. Using a combination of card draw, counter spells, and low-cost spells like Tolarian Terror and LÃ³rien Reveals, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain a consistent aggression. With a focus on tempo and board presence, the deck looks to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize, leading to a fast-paced and proactive playstyle.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a mix of artifacts and creatures. By utilizing cards that generate value when they enter or leave the battlefield, as well as sacrificing artifacts for additional effects, it aims to maintain a steady stream of threats and resources. With a combination of aggressive creatures and burn spells, it aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero before they can stabilize. The mana base is built around primarily artifact lands to enable the deck's affinity mechanic and fuel powerful spells like Galvanic Blast and Thoughtcast.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board with removal spells while using card draw and graveyard interaction to generate card advantage and disrupt opponents' strategies. With a mix of counterspells, removal, and card draw, the deck aims to out-value opponents by efficiently managing resources and controlling the pace of the game. Angler serves as a finisher that can quickly close out the game once opponents' resources have been depleted. The deck utilizes a mix of traditional control elements with graveyard synergy to create a powerful and resilient strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana using High Tide and various card draw spells, allowing the player to cast a large number of spells in a single turn and potentially win the game with a powerful combo. The deck also includes cards like Gigadrowse and Hidden Strings to disrupt the opponent's strategy and protect the combo. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its key pieces and overwhelm the opponent with a big mana advantage.

The main focus of this Gruul Aggro deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Utopia Sprawl and Arbor Elf, while disrupting the opponent's mana base with Mwonvuli Acid-Moss and Thermokarst. Annoyed Altisaur and Avenging Hunter are used as aggressive beaters, supported by Nyxborn Hydra and Eldrazi Repurposer for additional threats. Writhing Chrysalis can create surprise blockers or attackers, while Malevolent Rumble can clear the opponent's board. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient creatures, backed up by powerful removal spells and mana disruption.

This aggressive Jund deck focuses on utilizing sacrifice effects, artifact recursion, and land destruction to overwhelm the opponent. By sacrificing creatures and artifacts, the player can gain value and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also incorporates removal spells and lifegain to stay ahead in the game. With a mix of creatures, artifacts, and spells, this deck aims to outpace the opponent and control the board through sacrifice and destruction effects.

This deck focuses on swift and aggressive creature plays using cards like Sneaky Snacker, Voldaren Epicure, and Kitchen Imp to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It also includes burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Fiery Temper to finish off the opponent's creatures or deal direct damage. Highway Robbery and Alms of the Vein provide additional ways to drain the opponent's life total while Grab the Prize can help keep up the pressure. The mana base consists of a mix of Swamps, Mountains, and dual lands to ensure consistent mana production.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the Urza lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, Mine) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. This allows the player to cast powerful spells and control the game by countering opponent's spells, recurring key cards with Mnemonic Wall and Ghostly Flicker, and generating card advantage. The deck also includes some lifegain spells like Weather the Storm and Pulse of Murasa to help survive against aggressive strategies, as well as utility creatures like Stonehorn Dignitary and LÃ³rien Revealed to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly build up a board presence with low-cost creatures like Delver of Secrets and Cryptic Serpent while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Spell Pierce and Dispel. The deck also includes card draw and graveyard manipulation spells like Thought Scour and Mental Note to maintain card advantage and enable the graveyard-focused spells like Tolarian Terror and Deem Inferior. The inclusion of Sleep of the Dead and LÃ³rien Revealed provides additional control options to protect the aggressive creatures and seal the victory.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with creatures and using reanimation spells to bring them back into play. Key cards like Stinkweed Imp and Satyr Wayfinder help fill up the graveyard, while cards like Dread Return and Lotleth Giant allow for powerful creature recursion combos. Gnaw to the Bone provides valuable lifegain while Malevolent Rumble helps control the board. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a steady stream of reanimated creatures and powerful combos, ultimately trying to outvalue and outpace the opponent for a decisive victory.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of countering spells, drawing cards, and utilizing cheap creatures to apply pressure. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while also efficiently powering out threats that can quickly close out the game. With a mix of card draw, counterspells, and efficient creatures, this deck aims to out value and out tempo the opponent in order to secure a victory.

The key concept of this Mono Black Aggro deck is to swarm the board with low-cost creatures and use sacrifice effects to pump up your creatures and draw cards. By sacrificing creatures like Carrion Feeder and using cards like Village Rites, you can increase your board presence while disrupting your opponent's strategy. The deck also includes removal spells like Snuff Out and creature enhancements like Corrupted Conviction to help push through damage and control the game. This aggressive strategy aims to overwhelm your opponent quickly and secure victory.

Utilizing low-cost creatures and efficient counterspells, this Mono Blue Aggro deck aims to overwhelm opponents with quick aggression and disruption. By leveraging cards like Faerie Miscreant and Spellstutter Sprite to maintain board presence and control, combined with card draw from Ninja of the Deep Hours and Of One Mind, the deck can quickly establish a dominant position on the battlefield. Mutagenic Growth and Snap provide additional utility and tempo advantage in order to push through damage and maintain pressure on opponents.

This deck focuses on aggressively playing low-cost creatures and using counter magic to control the board. By quickly putting pressure on the opponent with Faerie Seer, Illvoi Galeblade, and Ninja of the Deep Hours, the deck aims to disrupt opponent's strategies with cards like Counterspell and Spellstutter Sprite. The inclusion of card draw spells like Of One Mind also helps to maintain card advantage and keep up the pressure. Overall, the deck's strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and disruptive spells.

This deck aims to aggressively deal damage to the opponent using cheap and efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Chain Lightning. The creatures in the deck provide additional damage and board presence, while also allowing for card advantage through Faithless Looting. The goal is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of direct damage and creature attacks, utilizing aggressive tactics to secure a victory.

The main focus of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent and deal direct damage to their life total. The deck utilizes cards like Alms of the Vein, Fiery Temper, and Lightning Bolt to actively target the opponent and finish them off. Additionally, cards like Grab the Prize and Highway Robbery help to disrupt the opponent's game plan and gain card advantage. Overall, this deck aims to be fast, aggressive, and efficient in taking down the opponent's life total before they can stabilize.
